tool_description: This API is focused on generating dynamic (content can be changed later) and static QR Codes, fully customized and with constant updates.
name: QR Code - Dynamic and Static
title: QR Code - Dynamic and Static

api_list.name: List Specific QR Code
api_list.description: From this endpoint is to get the information of a specific registered qr code, related to the respective api key

api_list.name: List All QR Code's
api_list.description: From this endpoint is to list all registered qr codes, related to their api key.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com/qrcode"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com/qrcode"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Generate API Key
api_list.description:
From this endpoint you can generate a single api key.

It will be used to link all the qr code created, and allow any changes.

Important: Keep in mind that once generated, it is necessary that you store this key well, since it is not possible to recover it, and without it, you do not have access to change any of your QR Codes.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com/user/generate"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Create Dynamic QR Code
api_list.description:
From this endpoint it is possible to create a new dynamic qr code.

Subsequently, it will also be listed among the qr codes created for that api key.

Important: Being dynamic, you can change both information such as title and description, and also the final link that will be redirected.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com/qrcode/dynamic"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Create Static QR Code
api_list.description:
From this endpoint it is possible to create a new static qr code.

Subsequently, it will also be listed among the qr codes created for that api key.

Important: Being static, only the title and description can be updated.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com/qrcode/static"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qr-code-dynamic-and-static1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
